message.content:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: String str = "10:52:21.212 [LoadFile] file = \"foo/bar/baz.xml\"";
StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(str, " ");
String filePath = "";

while (st.hasMoreTokens()) {
    String token = st.nextToken();
    if (token.startsWith("\"")) {
        filePath = token.substring(1, token.length() - 1);
        break;
    }
}

System.out.println(filePath);
<<<explanation>>>: In this code, we first create a StringTokenizer object with the input string and a space (" ") as the delimiter. Then, we iterate through the tokens using the hasMoreTokens() method. Inside the loop, we check if the current token starts with a double quote (") using the startsWith() method. If it does, we extract the file path by removing the double quotes using the substring() method. Finally, we print the extracted file path.
